instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi there,

I'm struggeling with an MBP 2012 15" (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>). It was running with typical screen blsckout issues so I resoldered <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with leaded solder but without success. So I wanted to replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. While removing it, it slipped out the tweezers and landed straight on the components around <RESISTOR>R8918</RESISTOR>. I put them back on place carefully and replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.
Now the Macbook does not turn on anymore. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD</SIGNAL> is missing because of missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>.
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>  gets power and enable voltage.

Thank you and best regards
Dudi

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you get RAM voltage at least?
Be sure to resolder all components correctly.
Do not solder components marked as "NOSTUFF".

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes I'm getting PP1V5R1V35_S3_MEM and <SIGNAL>PP0V75_S3_MEM</SIGNAL>.
I resoldered all components very carefully. Had a donor board where i was able to compare the original positions of the components.
No NOSTUFF components soldered ;-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 19, 20, 15, 7.
If all good, change it.
Be sure no short to ground at L7100.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Pins 19,20,15 and 7 seem to be good (5V, 5V, 3.3V and 0.65V)
Got 8.5 Ohms on L7100.
Changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> but same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check surrounding components, solders and traces.
Replace R/<CAPACITOR>C7130</CAPACITOR>, just in case.
